  Item File Name  (.gif) Description/Hoover Help
Old
New Full
Status
1 Configurations configs shows the configurations of the Eclipse-based application   
2 Updates updates shows sites an Eclipse app can be updated from   
3 Preview preview shows details of the selected object   
4 Web Browser browser a fully-functioning Web browser (hosts IE5 - Windows only)   
5 Update Perspective update_pers Represents Install/Update perspective in the UI

Local Toolbar
1 Go Backward  backward_nav
A standard browser 'backward' button
 Go Backward 
    
2 Go Forward  forward_nav
A standard browser 'forward' button
 Go Forward 
    
3 Go  go_nav
A standard browser button for navigating to a URL.
 Go 
    
4 Go Home  home_nav
A standard browser button for going to the home location
 Go Home 
    
5 Refresh  refresh_nav
Refresh the contents of the view
 Refresh 
    
6 Stop stop_nav
A standard browser button for stopping the navigation in progress
 Stop  
    
7 Show Unconfigured Features show_unconf
A toggle button that allows unconfigured features to show in the view
 Show Unconfigured Features 
   
Model Object
1  Application Configuration  app_obj the current configuration used to load the current application
2 My Computer  computer_obj the file system root

3  Feature  feature_obj feature object

4 Unconfigured Feature  unconf_feature_obj feature that is currently unconfigured (i.e. still present but disabled in the current configuration)

5 Places to Visit places_obj a folder that contains bookmarks to remote sites that contain cool features  
6 Site site_obj  update site object that represent a provider site (site that is set up to act as a source of features)

7 Local Site lsite_obj update site object that represents a receiver site (site that is set up to act as a target of the feature installation)  
8 Feature Category category_obj sites can classify features they host into hierarchical categories

 
9 Bookmark Folder bfolder_obj folder object in the view that provides for organizing site bookmarks and search objects

 
10 Text Search tsearch_obj Text search object 

11 Update Search usearch_obj Available Updates search object

12 Plug-in Search psearch_obj Plug-in search object

13 Fixed Volume vfixed_obj Local file system volume that represents a fixed drive (Windows) or folder (Linux)
14 Remote Volume vremote_obj Remote file system volume that represents a shared drive (Window) or mounted volume (Linux)  
15 Removable Volume vremovable_obj Removable file system volume that is neither CD-ROM nor Floppy Disk. This image is used for all other removable volumes like DVD-ROM, various PCMCIA cards etc.  
16 CD-ROM cd_obj File system volume that represent a CD-ROM drive

17 Floppy Disk floppy_obj File system volume that represents a 3 1/2 inch floppy disk drive

18 Saved Configurations saved_obj Folder that holds past configurations that have been preserved and/or renamed
19 Configuration History history_obj Folder that holds past configurations
20 Available Updates updates_obj Update Search object that is pre-configured to look for available updates of all the installed features. It cannot be removed from the view.
21 Configuration config_obj A configuration history entry that represents one configuration
Object Overlay
1  current current_co   indicates that the configuration is current i.e. in effect

2  error error_co  will be overlayed over PDE editor objects that are somehow associated with XML syntax or validation errors 

3  installable installable_co  indicates that site can accept features during installation

4  linked linked_co  indicates that the site is only linked to the configuration

5 unconfigured unconfigured_co 

Forms Artwork
1  Topic topic   an image to be used as a custom bullet for items in a 'Welcome' page
2 Default Provider def_provider  an image to be used in a feature description page in cases where one was not supplied by feature provider (should be JPEG)  
3  Form Banner form_banner  a banner image used in all form pages behind the heading (shown here in 1:10 zoom out)  

4  Form Banner Underline form_underline  a second portion of the banner used under the heading text (shown here in 1:10 zoom out)  

Wizard Graphic
1 New Bookmark wizard  new_bookmark_wiz creates a new update site bookmark  
2 New Folder wizard  new_folder_wiz creates a new bookmark folder  
3 New Search wizard  new_search_wiz creates a new search object  
4 Install Feature wizard  install_wiz installs a new feature into the platform  
5 Update Feature wizard  update_wiz installs a newer version of an already installed feature  
6 Configure Feature wizard  config_wiz configures or unconfigures an installed feature  
7 Uninstall Feature wizard  uninstall_wiz permanently removes a feature from the platform  
8 Default Install Wizard banner  def_wizban a default image shown in install wizard pages when one is not supplied by feature providers
